subject: Dear Sir/Madam,
body:
Dear Sir/Madam,
Re: NEXT OF KIN AND PROBATE
It is with utmost good faith but a great sense of responsibility I
send this offer cum business proposal to you hoping that if you are
not interested you may pass it on. Sometimes in June 2022, an
expatriate, a foreign national attached to the Nigerian Gas Company
was kidnapped and brutally murdered in Yenogoa, the capital of the
restive Niger Delta state of Bayelsa was kidnapped and brutally
murdered off the Coast of the Atlantic.
However, prior to his kidnap and eventual murder he had deposited with
us in SAFE DEPOSIT WITH PASSWORD, the sum of 20 MILLION US DOLLARS.
This we were informed by the expatriate was proceeds from Illegal
bunkering of BONNY LIGHT crude oil from the terminal in Bonny.
Since his death, we have made spirited efforts to locate his family or
NEXT OF KIN to collect this box and the funds therein, all to no
avail. Under our laws after one year such funds will be forfeited to
the government which we do not want to happen, hence this proposal.
With your kind permission, we want to front you as the Next of kin to
the deceased, and have these funds LEGALLY delivered to you, but for
our mutual interest. It does not really matter where you are from
provided you are a foreigner.
Our proposal therefore, is that if you successfully claim the funds,
you can keep 50% of it and transfer the other 50% to an account we
will nominate to you. Note that all probate laws as it applies to
foreigners who died intestate in Nigeria, will be strictly complied
with, to avoid any risk to all the parties concerned.
Should you be interested, kindly contact the undersigned for further
information and requirements moving forward.
I look forward to hearing from you as time is of the essence and we
are racing against time.
With kind regards,
Kingsley Moghalu

subject: Re:   Dear Sir/Madam,
body:
Dear Kingsley Moghalu,

Thank you for reaching out to me with this business proposal. I appreciate your trust in sharing this information with me. I understand that you are looking for a foreigner to act as the next of kin to the deceased and help transfer the funds legally. 

I have a few questions before we proceed. Firstly, could you provide more details about the deceased individual? It would be helpful to know their name, nationality, and any other relevant information. Additionally, what is the total amount of funds that are currently in the safe deposit? 

Furthermore, I would like to understand the legal process involved in claiming these funds and how we can ensure that all probate laws are followed correctly. Can you please explain this in more detail?

Thank you again for considering me for this opportunity. I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Hilda
